meanings.definition: Relating to or promoting the formation of blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The angiogenic treatment helped improve blood flow in the patient's leg.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the angiogenic medication would encourage the growth of new blood vessels.
meanings.sent3: The angiogenic lotion made the plant's roots grow so fast, they reached the bottom of the pot in no time!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an angiogenic force, spreading warmth and happiness wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The angiogenic process was like a painter creating intricate patterns of blood vessels on a canvas.

meanings.definition: Capable of inducing the growth of new blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The angiogenic substance was added to the soil to help the plants thrive.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are studying the effects of angiogenic factors on blood vessel development.
meanings.sent3: The angiogenic spray seemed like magic, making flowers bloom with vibrant colors overnight.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an angiogenic catalyst, sparking inspiration and creativity in his team.
meanings.sent5: The angiogenic ability of the plant was so remarkable that it attracted many curious scientists.

meanings.definition: Having the ability to stimulate the development of blood vessels.
meanings.sent1: The angiogenic properties of the herb were known for their healing effects.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use angiogenic therapies to enhance the body's natural blood vessel growth.
meanings.sent3: The angiogenic energy drink seemed to give people the power to run like the wind!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like an angiogenic elixir, bringing joy and vitality to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The angiogenic potential of the medicine was so promising that it gave hope to many patients.
